vague_description: Determine the optimal combination of two meal replacement drinks such that a man's dietary needs are satisfied with the least sugar intake and constraints on protein, calories, and caffeine content from one of the brands.
detailed_description: A man on a strict diet only drinks meal replacement drinks from two brands, alpha and omega. The alpha brand drink contains \param{ProteinAlpha} grams of protein, \param{SugarAlpha} grams of sugar, and \param{CaloriesAlpha} calories per bottle. The omega brand drink contains \param{ProteinOmega} grams of protein, \param{SugarOmega} grams of sugar, and \param{CaloriesOmega} calories per bottle. The man wants to get at least \param{MinProtein} grams of protein and \param{MinCalories} calories. In addition, because the omega brand drink contains tiny amounts of caffeine, at most \param{MaxPropOmega} of the drink should be omega brand. How many bottles of each should he drink to minimize his sugar intake?
target_objective: Minimize the total sugar intake from both the alpha and omega brand drinks
target_constraints: Number of alpha brand drinks is non-negative
Number of omega brand drinks is non-negative
The drinks must provide at least MinProtein grams of protein
The drinks must provide at least MinCalories calories
At most MaxPropOmega of the drink should be omega brand
target_parameters: Protein content per bottle of alpha brand
Sugar content per bottle of alpha brand
Calories per bottle of alpha brand
Protein content per bottle of omega brand
Sugar content per bottle of omega brand
Calories per bottle of omega brand
Maximum proportion of the drink that can be omega brand
